intro: Psilactis brevilingulata, commonly known as the short-lipped psilactis, is a rare and specialized plant species characterized by its unique botanical features. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and flowering plants. The plant is distinguished by its small, clustered flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
